titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Wallace Earle Stegner Creative Writing Program : correspondence and manuscripts , 1949-1992
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California

defitem.label: Processed by:
defitem.item: Glen Denny and Timothy Noakes ; Laura Barnaby

titlepage.p: © 1999 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Wallace Earle Stegner Creative Writing Program : correspondence and manuscripts ,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Wallace Stegner, 1987, 1989, 1990, 1991, and his estate, 1995.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Wallace Earle Stegner Creative Writing Program : correspondence and manuscripts , M0558, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American author. Head of the Creative Writing Program at Stanford for many years. The Creative Writing Center was founded in 1946 and was the second degree granting program (after Iowa) in the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Primarily incoming correspondence and some outgoing. Includes literary manuscripts by Pauline Bates Alden, Frank Bergon, Neilma Gantner, Mary Jane Moffat, Jack Nisbet, and Nancy Packer.

did.unittitle: Series I: Letters to and from Stegner, with other contents of envelopes: resumes, publicity blurbs, clippings, and short pieces.
ABBEY, Edward, 1927-: 2 items, 1972-1977.With a letter from American Academy and Institute of Arts and Letters to Stegner re. Abbey, Sept. 8. 1983.
ABRAMSON, []: 1 letter of recommendation by Stegner, 1956.
ALDEN, Paulette Bates. 1947-: 9 items, 1970-1991.With 2 letters from Greywolf Press to Stegner re: Alden and 1 article by Alden. See also Series II.
ARNOLD, Maxwell Jr. (Bud): 12 items, 1948-1992.With 2 letters of recommendation by Stegner and one letter from Fred Graeser re. Arnold.
BALL, Jane Eklund: 1 item, 1990.With 1 Memorial Service Announcement (1992)and with 1 letter of recommendation from Stegner, 1954.
BATES, Paulette: See ALDEN, Paulette Bates.
BERESFORD, Thomas Patrick: 1 item, 1986.With 2 short stories by Beresford; 1 letter by Stegner re: Beresford.
BERGON, Frank: 7 items, 1977-1989.With resume and grant proposal. See also Series II.
BERRY, Wendell, 1934-: 12 items, 1962-1984.With 1 response from Stegner, 1987.See also Series II.
BEYER, Jean: 1 item and 1 letter from Foreground re. Beyer, n.d.
BONTLY, Thomas, 1939-: 27 items, 1967-90.With photocopy of The Blue Smile by Thomas Bontly.
BRACHER, Fred: 1 letter from Stegner re. Helen Prentice and Larry Lawrence, 1956.
BURDICK, Eugene A.[Bud] (Eugene Allan), 1912-: 9 items, 1947-1953.With reply from Stegner, 1949;newspaper clippings re: Burdick at Oxford.
CADLE, Dean: 4 items, 1973,and 1 letter from Philip E. Cranston re. Cadle, 1973.
CANZONERI, Robert: 1 item, n.d.,1 item, 1973.With 2 letters from Donald E. Stanford.
CHAMPION, Hale: 1 letter of recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
CHANEY, Bev: 3 items, 1991.With 1 response from Stegner, 1991.
CHOWDER, Ken [Glantz, Ken]: 18 items, 1980-1990.With 1 letter to Stegner re: Delicate Geometry, 1982.See Series II.
CLARK, Walter Van Tilburg, 1909-1971:2 letters from J. Paul Leonard re. Clark, 1955-1956,and 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
DAHL, []: 1 letter of recommendation from Stegner, 1956.
DANESHVAR, Simin, 1921-: 8 items, 1963-1983.With 4 items from Farzenah MILANI to Stegner re. Daneshvar; article on Daneshvar by Milani.
DANIEL, John, 1948-: 27 items, 1983-1992.With letter to Stegner from publisher re. Daniel. See Series II.
DAVIE, Donald: 2 items, 1972and 1977.See also Series II.
DeVOTO, Bernard Augustine, 1897-1955:6 items, 1944-1948.With 4 letters from Stegner.
DOUST, Dudley: 1 telegram from Time, Inc. re. Doust, 1946,and 1 recommendation from Stegner.
FANG, Liewche Tu: 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1954.
FRANKS, Ann Russell: 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
FULLER, Blair: 4 items, 1960-1988.With letter from publisher to Stegner re. Fuller.
GAINES, Ernest J., 1933-: 1 letter to Stegner re. Gaines from MacArthur Foundation with attached bibliography.
GANGEMI, Kenneth, 1937-: 7 items, 1973-1991.With Xerox copy of Gangemi's book cover; Classroon Observation Report, 1991.See also Series II.
GIBBONS, Eileen: 1 letter from Carlton Culmsee re. Gibbons and 1 response from Stegner, 1954.
GLEASON, Venetia T.: 1 item, n.d.See also Series II.
GREEN, Hannah: 13 items, 1967-1991.With 1 letter of recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
GRIFFITH, Beatrice: 1 item, c1954.With 1response and 1 recommendation from Stegner, both 1954.
HALBERT, Sara F.: 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
HEINTZE, Carl: 17 items, 1970-1991.See also Series II.
HOLLISTER, Michael: 2 items, 1982-1989.With synopsis of Snake River; Compilation of Quotations from Meredoth; copy of letter to Hollister from John L'Heureux re. Snake River.
HOUSTON, James H.: 6 items, 1963-1990.See also Series II.
HUNT, Mary Fassett: 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
KITTREDGE, William: 5 items, 1978-1991.With Centennial Book Project listing.
KOHLER, Mary: 1 item, n.d.With 1 response from Stegner, 1954.
LAMME, Guy Hugh:: 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
LAWRENCE, Oliver: 1 item, n.d.;2 items 1948and 1990.With 2 letters from Edwin R. Clapp re. Lawrence and 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1955.
L'HEUREUX, John: 3 items, 1983-1987.With form letter to Stegner Fellows requesting material for anthology from Stanford Creative Writing Program.
McCORISON, Marcus A. (Marcus Allan): See Series II.
McMURRAY, George R., 1925-: 1 letter from Raymond Barry and 1 recommendation from Stegner, 1954.
McMURTRY, Larry: 1 item, n.d.See also Series II.
MILANI, Farzaneh: See Daneshvar, Simin. See also Series II.
MOFFAT, Mary Jane: 3 items, n.d., 1985-1986.See also Series II.
MOMADAY, Natachee Scott: 6 items, 1968-1969, 1989-1991.With article about Momaday. See also Schubnell, Matthais. See also Series II.
MULHEIM, Harry: 2 items, 1972-1991.With article re. Mulheim.
PACKER, Nancy Huddleston: 2 items, 1987.With 2 letters from publisher to Stegner re. Packer. See also Series Two.
POPHAM, Melinda Worth: 3 items, 1989-1990.With 3 letters to Stegner from Greywolf Press re. Popham. See also Series II.
PRENTICE, Helen: 3 items, 1956-1991.With 2 recommendations from Stegner, 1956.
PUTNAM, Clay: 1 letter from Charles W. Cole re. Putnam, 1954;2 letters from Charles Marsh re. Putnam; 1 letter from John L. Clark; and recommendations from Stegner, 1954-1955.
ROSENBERG, Edgar: 3 items, 1955-1968.With 3 recommendations from Stegner, 1956.
SCHAEPMAN, Paul M.: 1 item, 1992.See also Series II.
SCHRAM, Wilbur: 1 letter to Stegner re. Schram.
SCOWCROFT, Richard: 6 items and 21 recommendations by Scowcroft, 1945-1979.
SEGRE, Claudio G.: 2 items, 1972-1990.With copy of diary entry (1959)by Segre re. Stegner.
STEWART, John, 1933-: Curriculum vitae; letter of recommendation (1982)from Stegner; MacArthur Foundation letter (1982).
STRUCINSKI, Mitchell J.: 3 items, 1960-1964.With letter from Stegner, 1960.
TANZER, Ward: 4 items, 1974-1983.With 1 letter to Tanzer from John Lynch.
TERRY, Marshall: 18 items, 1970-1991.With article re. Terry. See also Series II.
TUROW, Scott: 1 item, 1987.See also Series II.
WHITE, Robin: 13 items, 1965-1992.With article re. Stegner.
WILLIAMSON, Barbara Tuerk: 1 item, 1990.Includes her student paper with comment by Stegner.
WORTHEN, Helena: 2 items, 1986.With jacket blurb from her novel.
YOUNG, Al: 3 items, 1976, 1987-88.With publicity for his novel. See also Series II.
Unidentified correspondence. Single correspondent (Neilma Gantner?) c1972-1987.
Series II: Literary Manuscripts, Publications, Stories.
ALDEN, Paulette Bates: Feeding the Eagles: Typed MS, n.d.
ALDEN, Paulette Bates: Feeding the Eagles: Typed MS, n.d.
BERGON, Frank: Shoshone Mike: Proofs, n.d.

BERRY, Wendell. Amplifications: Preserving Wilderness. in Wilderness, vol. 50, no. 176 (Sping 1987). How Will It Be and The Mad Farmer Revolution. In Sequoia, 1976.Issue also includes poems by Donald Davie, Venetia Gleason, N. Scott Momaday and Al Young.
CHOWDER, Ken: Those lop-eared, whopper jawed, jack-legged Californians: Mark Twain's California. n.d.
DANIEL, John: Pack Rat, copy of transcript: n.d.Proof copy of Daniel's review of Stegner's publications.
GANGEMI, Kenneth. Names. In Ploughshares, vol. 12, no. 4.
GANTNER, Neilma: A Brief resume of the Australian Fellows at Stanford. Cassette recording.
HALL, Donald. Argument and Persuasion. In Antaeus, no. 58 (Spring 1987).Issue also includes Jonathan Baumbach, Donald Justice and Robert Hass.
HEINTZE, Carl: A View of the Valley. Typed MS, n.d.
HORGAN, David: The Golden West Trio Plus One: Published edition, 1988.(Attached photo of Horgan's son)
HOUSTON, James D.: Love Life (New York: Alfred A. Knopf, 1985).
McCLANAHAN, Ed: Famous People I Have Known. (New York: Farrar Straus Giroux, 1985).
McCORISON, Marcus A.: The Bayley-Hazeb Military Road, 1959.
McMURTRY, Larry: A Walk in Pasadena with Di-Annie and Mary Alice. In California, vol. 12, no. 3 (May, 1987).
MILANI, Farzani: Power, Prudence, and Print: Censorship and Simin Danashvar, 1985.
MOFFAT, Mary Jane: City of Roses: Stories from Girlhood. (Santa Barbara: John Daniel, 1986).City of Roses: Stories from Girlhood. Photocopy of corrected galleys.
NISBET, Jack: Sky People. Typed MS, galleys, 1984.
PACKER, Nancy: In My Father's House. Galleys, n.d.
PACKER, Nancy: The Women who Walk and other stories. Typed MS, n.d.
POPHAM, Melinda Worth: Skywalker: Typed MS, n.d.(pp. 1-126).
POPHAM, Melinda Worth: Skywalker: Typed MS, n.d.:(pp. 127-257).
SCHAEPMAN, Paul: Phaedra and Cassandra, La Balada De Salteador de Comidos, Swala Tomi.
TERRY, Marshall: Ringer: Typed MS, with corrections, 1986.
TUROW, Scott. Presumed Innocent. Typed MS, n.d.
WEAVER, Will. Red Earth, White Earth. (New York: Simon and Schuster, 1986).
